content.question:
A research agency surveyed <math alttext="2,209" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mtext>,209</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> residents who live in one of three districts in a county: urban, suburban, or rural. The residents were asked to choose one of four categories that aligned with their opinion on how wireless infrastructure in the county should be paid for: wage tax, sales tax, property tax, or user fee.
When investigating whether opinion about how the wireless infrastructure should be paid for is independent of the district in which residents live, which of the following is the correct degrees of freedom for the appropriate chi-square test?

topic.text: 8.6: Carrying Out a Chi-Square Test for Homogeneity or Independence

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Calculate a test statistic and find a p-value, provided conditions for inference are met.
